summary: The Great Lakes Mass Marking Program Act of 2025 aims to establish a program within the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service to mass mark hatchery-produced fish in the Great Lakes. This is intended to aid in fisheries management, research, and habitat restoration, specifically by evaluating hatchery effectiveness, understanding fish populations, and supporting economic activities related to the Great Lakes. The bill authorizes appropriations of $5,000,000 annually from 2026-2030 and mandates collaboration with various agencies and the use of collected data to improve management strategies.
